page.title: 03FEATURES OF FULFORD
page.content: The school of Fulford is 190 m. above sea level.There is only one school.The school was built in the 1920's.There are some interesting features such as the local farms.These include Flatts Farm and Fulford Manor as examples.The Public House is called the Shoulder of Mutton and is of a great age. Fulford has a typical "English " village green.This was originally used as common grazing but today it provides a useful area for village fetes and child play.Here is located the main post box which is convenient for the older members of the community who live facing onto the green.
